sn2.17:1.1: Probably not the same individual as the “independent divinity” Subrahmā (SN 6.6–8 and DN 20:20.1). In the Rig Veda, subrahma meant “good sacred formulation” (Rig Veda 7.16.2, 10.47.3, 10.62.4)
sn2.17:3.1: PTS reads bojjhaṅgatapasā; Yogācārabhūmi Śarīrārthagāthā 5.2 hasjñānatapaso; SA 596 seems to pass over bojjha; while SA2 181 has 智慧者, “wise one”. I follow Bodhi in accepting the MS reading, nāññatra bojjhā tapasā.
sn2.17:4.1: This prose fragment is unusual here. Such endings are normally abbreviated in the Pali, although they are retained in the Chinese.
